steps.text: The pilot of RYR4735, a Boeing 737-800 at Stand 4, requests taxi clearance to runway 31.
Ground control instructs RYR4735 to taxi to holding point C1 via taxiways Alpha and Charlie, and advises to contact Tower on 118.3 when reaching C1.
Upon reaching C1, the pilot switches to Malta Tower frequency and reports holding short runway 31, ready for departure.
Tower acknowledges RYR4735, and provides takeoff clearance.
The pilot reads back the takeoff clearance, lines up, and commences the takeoff roll on runway 31.
After becoming airborne, the pilot reports to Tower: RYR4735 is airborne, passing 1000 feet.
Tower acknowledges the airborne report and instructs RYR4735 to contact Malta Radar on 128.15.
The pilot switches to Malta Radar and reports climbing through 1500 feet.

takeoff.name: Takeoff Simulation - Air Malta TCAS Fault

steps.text: The pilot of KM514, an Airbus A320 at Stand 5, contacts Malta Ground requesting taxi clearance to runway 31.
Ground instructs KM514 to taxi to holding point C1 via Alpha and Charlie, and to switch to Tower frequency 118.3 at C1.
KM514 switches to Malta Tower and reports holding short of runway 31 at C1, ready for departure.
KM514 then reports a TCAS system fault and requests to return to stand for technical inspection.
Tower acknowledges the report, instructs KM514 to hold position momentarily, and coordinates with ground for a return route.
Tower instructs KM514 to taxi back to Stand 5 via Charlie and Alpha, and to contact Ground on 121.9.
KM514 reads back taxi instructions and confirms switching to Ground.

takeoff.name: Takeoff Simulation - Lufthansa Bird Strike Rejection

steps.text: The pilot of DLH1307, an Airbus A321 at Stand 7, contacts Malta Ground to request taxi clearance to runway 31.
Ground control gives DLH1307 taxi instructions to holding point C1 via Alpha and Charlie, and tells them to contact Tower on 118.3 at C1.
DLH1307 contacts Malta Tower and reports holding short runway 31 at C1, ready for departure.
Tower clears DLH1307 for takeoff from runway 31.
Shortly after initiating takeoff, the pilot reports rejecting takeoff due to a bird strike and requests assistance.
Tower acknowledges the rejected takeoff, instructs DLH1307 to vacate the runway if able, and dispatches emergency services.
The pilot confirms they are vacating runway 31 and standing by for emergency inspection.
Tower confirms the action and notifies other traffic of the temporary runway closure.
KM514, cruising at FL340 over waypoint DIBAK, checks in with Malta Radar.
Malta Radar confirms radar contact and instructs KM514 to proceed direct to waypoint EVIRA.
KM514 acknowledges direct to EVIRA.
Malta Radar advises upcoming FIR boundary and provides next frequency for Rome Control.
KM514 reads back frequency and confirms readiness to switch.
Malta Radar instructs KM514 to contact Rome Control on 132.35.
KM514 confirms frequency change and signs off from Malta Radar.
DLH1307, cruising at FL360 over waypoint GODAK, contacts Malta Radar with a PAN PAN call due to a sick passenger.
Malta Radar acknowledges the urgency and requests nature of illness and souls on board.
DLH1307 reports an unconscious passenger with difficulty breathing and 168 persons on board.
Malta Radar clears DLH1307 to descend to FL100 and directs aircraft toward MALTA VOR for an approach to runway 31.
DLH1307 reads back descent and vectors and advises they are preparing for landing.
Malta Radar provides vectors for a straight-in ILS approach and informs DLH1307 that emergency services are standing by.
DLH1307 confirms emergency services coordination and configures for landing.
Malta Radar hands DLH1307 over to Malta Tower for final approach.
Malta Radar attempts to contact RYR4735 at FL380 over waypoint PETIP, but receives no response.
Malta Radar tries again on primary frequency, then switches to secondary and broadcasts to all stations for relay assistance.
A nearby aircraft relays message to RYR4735, but still no reply. Malta Radar initiates radio failure procedures.
Malta Radar informs ATC supervisor and begins preparing coordination with next FIR in case of full COM loss.
RYR4735 re-establishes contact via secondary frequency, reports previous radio failure now resolved.
Malta Radar acknowledges and confirms flight parameters and position.
RYR4735 confirms still at FL380, direct to waypoint DORAT.
Malta Radar clears RYR4735 to continue as filed and informs to monitor 128.15.
RYR4735 confirms and resumes normal operations.
The Air Malta flight (KM102) informs approach control that they are descending to 3,000 feet and approaching the waypoint DIBAK.
Approach control acknowledges and instructs KM102 to proceed directly to the MALTA VOR, and informs them that they should expect an ILS approach to runway 31.
The pilot confirms they are heading to the MALTA VOR and expecting the ILS approach for runway 31.
Approach now tells KM102 to descend to 2,000 feet and clears them for the ILS approach to runway 31.
The pilot confirms the descent and that they are cleared for the ILS approach.
Approach tells the aircraft to switch to Luqa Tower frequency to continue the landing sequence.
The pilot acknowledges and switches to the tower frequency.

landing.name: Landing Simulation - Go-Around Due to Runway Incursion

steps.text: A Lufthansa flight (DLH1307) reports to the tower that they are on the ILS approach for runway 13 and are five miles from the runway.
The tower responds that the approach may continue, but warns the pilot that a vehicle was reported close to the runway threshold.
The pilot acknowledges the caution and continues the approach.
Shortly after, the tower spots the vehicle on the runway and instructs the pilot to perform a go-around for safety.
The pilot confirms they are going around.
The tower instructs the aircraft to climb to 3,000 feet while maintaining the runway heading.
The pilot confirms the heading and climb.
The tower hands the aircraft off to approach control so they can be vectored back for another attempt.
The pilot acknowledges and switches to the approach frequency.

landing.name: Landing Simulation - Low Visibility CAT II Approach

steps.text: A Ryanair flight (RYR4735) calls in to approach control, stating that they are descending to 2,500 feet and nearing waypoint DORAT.

Approach confirms radar contact and tells the aircraft to proceed directly to MALTA VOR. They also inform the pilot that a low-visibility Category II ILS approach will be used, and report the runway visibility as 350 meters.
The pilot confirms the instructions and acknowledges they are preparing for a Category II ILS approach.
Approach instructs the aircraft to descend further to 1,800 feet and clears them for the CAT II approach to runway 31.
The pilot confirms the new altitude and that they are cleared for the Category II approach.
Approach tells the aircraft to switch to Luqa Tower frequency for the final landing phase.
The pilot acknowledges and switches to the tower frequency.
